how can i find out what device 'hdc' ref: it is the third IDE disk.  HD means hard disk and the a-z after it indicates your ide disk (hda=primary,hdb=slave is channel 1, hdc=primary,hdd=slave is channel 2)
is it used to refer to cd-rom drives too?
yup, whatever is on the IDE channel.  SATA (serial ATA) and SCSI devices appear as /dev/sdx
